templates.title: Baking Procedures SOP Template
templates.content:
STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE
BAKING PROCEDURES

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TITLE: [Product Name] Baking Procedure
LAST UPDATED: [Date]
REVIEW DATE: [Date + 6 months]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

OBJECTIVE:
To ensure consistent quality and taste for [Product Name] by following standardized baking procedures.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SCOPE:
This SOP applies to all bakers and kitchen staff involved in preparing [Product Name].

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

MATERIALS & EQUIPMENT NEEDED:
□ Stand mixer
□ Mixing bowls (sizes: ___)
□ Measuring cups and spoons
□ Baking pans (type: ___)
□ Oven thermometer
□ Timer
□ Cooling racks
□ Parchment paper
□ Ingredients (see recipe below)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

PROCEDURE:

PREPARATION (15 minutes before baking):
1. Preheat oven to [Temperature]°F ([Temperature]°C)
2. Verify oven temperature with thermometer
3. Prepare baking pans: [grease/line with parchment/spray]
4. Gather all ingredients and measure precisely
5. Bring ingredients to room temperature (if required)

MIXING:
1. In stand mixer bowl, combine [dry ingredients]
   - Mix on low speed for [time] until evenly distributed

2. In separate bowl, combine [wet ingredients]
   - Whisk until [consistency/appearance]

3. Add [wet/dry] ingredients to mixer
   - Mix on [speed] for [time] until [consistency]
   - Scrape down bowl sides at [interval]

4. Add [additional ingredients] (if applicable)
   - Fold in gently / Mix on low for [time]

5. QUALITY CHECK: Batter/dough should be [describe appearance, texture, consistency]

PORTIONING:
1. Divide batter/dough into [number] portions
2. Each portion should weigh approximately [weight] grams/ounces
3. Fill pans to [level - e.g., 2/3 full]
4. Smooth tops with spatula (if needed)

BAKING:
1. Place pans in preheated oven on [rack position]
2. Set timer for [time] minutes
3. DO NOT open oven door for first [time] minutes
4. Check for doneness at [time] minutes:
   □ Visual cue: [golden brown edges, set center, etc.]
   □ Touch test: [springs back, firm to touch, etc.]
   □ Toothpick test: [comes out clean, few crumbs, etc.]
   □ Internal temperature: [temperature]°F (if applicable)

5. If not done, continue baking in [time] minute increments
6. Total baking time: [min]-[max] minutes

COOLING:
1. Remove from oven when done
2. Let cool in pan for [time] minutes
3. Turn out onto cooling rack
4. Cool completely before [decorating/packaging/storing]
   - Cooling time: approximately [time] minutes/hours

STORAGE:
1. Store in [airtight container/refrigerator/freezer]
2. Shelf life: [time period]
3. Label with: Product name, date baked, use-by date

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

QUALITY CHECKPOINTS:
□ Oven temperature verified before baking
□ Ingredients measured precisely
□ Batter/dough consistency matches standard
□ Baking time and temperature followed exactly
□ Product appearance matches quality standard
□ Taste and texture consistent with previous batches
□ Proper cooling completed before storage

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SAFETY NOTES:
⚠️ Always use oven mitts when handling hot pans
⚠️ Verify oven temperature - do not rely on dial alone
⚠️ Keep work area clean to prevent cross-contamination
⚠️ Wash hands before starting and after handling raw ingredients
⚠️ Check for allergens in all ingredients

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TROUBLESHOOTING:

Problem: Product is too dry
Solution: Check oven temperature (may be too high), reduce baking time by 2-3 minutes, verify ingredient measurements

Problem: Product is undercooked in center
Solution: Reduce oven temperature by 25°F and increase baking time, check oven hot spots, use oven thermometer

Problem: Uneven browning
Solution: Rotate pans halfway through baking, check oven rack position, verify oven calibration

Problem: Product sinks in middle
Solution: Do not open oven door too early, verify leavening agents are fresh, check mixing time

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

NOTES FOR UPDATES:
If you believe this SOP needs changes, document the issue and suggested improvement. Submit to manager for review.

If supplies are missing or equipment malfunctions, notify manager immediately.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

APPROVAL:
Created by: _________________ Date: _______
Approved by: ________________ Date: _______
Next Review: _______

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

templates.title: Food Safety & Sanitation SOP Template
templates.content:
STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE
FOOD SAFETY & SANITATION

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TITLE: Food Safety and Sanitation Procedures
LAST UPDATED: [Date]
REVIEW DATE: [Date + 6 months]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

OBJECTIVE:
To maintain food safety standards, prevent foodborne illness, and ensure compliance with health regulations.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SCOPE:
This SOP applies to ALL bakery staff, volunteers, and anyone handling food or working in the kitchen.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

1. PERSONAL HYGIENE

HANDWASHING (REQUIRED):
Wash hands thoroughly for 20 seconds with soap and warm water:
□ Before starting work
□ After using the restroom
□ After touching face, hair, or body
□ After handling raw ingredients (especially eggs)
□ After touching phone, money, or non-food items
□ After sneezing, coughing, or blowing nose
□ After taking out trash
□ After any break

PROPER HANDWASHING TECHNIQUE:
1. Wet hands with warm running water
2. Apply soap and lather for 20 seconds
3. Scrub backs of hands, between fingers, under nails
4. Rinse thoroughly under running water
5. Dry with clean paper towel or air dryer
6. Use paper towel to turn off faucet

PERSONAL APPEARANCE:
□ Hair tied back and covered (hair net, bandana, or hat)
□ Clean apron or chef coat
□ No jewelry except plain wedding band
□ Fingernails short, clean, and unpolished
□ No artificial nails or nail polish
□ Closed-toe, non-slip shoes

WHEN NOT TO WORK:
Do NOT work if you have:
□ Fever, vomiting, or diarrhea
□ Open cuts or sores on hands (unless covered with glove)
□ Symptoms of illness (coughing, sneezing, runny nose)
→ Notify manager immediately if you are ill

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

2. CROSS-CONTAMINATION PREVENTION

SEPARATE EQUIPMENT:
□ Use separate cutting boards for allergens (if applicable)
□ Use separate utensils for different products
□ Never use same spoon for tasting and mixing
□ Wash hands between handling different products

CLEAN AS YOU GO:
□ Wipe down work surfaces between tasks
□ Wash utensils immediately after use
□ Keep work area organized and clutter-free
□ Dispose of waste promptly

ALLERGEN MANAGEMENT:
□ Clearly label all allergen-containing ingredients
□ Store allergen ingredients separately
□ Clean all surfaces before preparing allergen-free items
□ Use dedicated equipment for allergen-free products (if possible)
□ Wash hands after handling common allergens (nuts, eggs, dairy)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

3. EQUIPMENT CLEANING & SANITIZING

DAILY CLEANING SCHEDULE:

MIXERS & BOWLS (after each use):
1. Disassemble all removable parts
2. Wash in hot soapy water or dishwasher
3. Rinse thoroughly
4. Sanitize with approved sanitizer solution
5. Air dry completely before reassembling

WORK SURFACES (between tasks and end of day):
1. Remove all items from surface
2. Wipe with hot soapy water
3. Rinse with clean water
4. Spray with sanitizer solution
5. Allow to air dry (do not wipe)

OVENS (weekly or as needed):
1. Allow to cool completely
2. Remove racks and wash separately
3. Wipe interior with appropriate cleaner
4. Clean door and exterior
5. Replace racks when dry

REFRIGERATOR/FREEZER (weekly):
1. Check and discard expired items
2. Wipe down shelves and walls
3. Clean door seals and handles
4. Check temperature: Refrigerator 35-38°F, Freezer 0°F or below

SANITIZER SOLUTION:
□ Use approved food-safe sanitizer
□ Follow manufacturer's dilution instructions
□ Test concentration with test strips
□ Replace solution when dirty or every 2 hours

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

4. INGREDIENT RECEIVING & STORAGE

RECEIVING DELIVERIES:
□ Check delivery temperature (refrigerated items should be 41°F or below)
□ Inspect packaging for damage, leaks, or pests
□ Check expiration dates - reject expired items
□ Verify order accuracy
□ Store immediately - do not leave at room temperature

STORAGE GUIDELINES:

DRY STORAGE:
□ Store in cool, dry area (50-70°F)
□ Keep off floor (6 inches minimum)
□ First In, First Out (FIFO) - rotate stock
□ Label with date received
□ Keep away from chemicals and cleaning supplies

REFRIGERATOR STORAGE (35-38°F):
□ Store dairy products on top shelves
□ Keep eggs in original carton
□ Cover all items to prevent cross-contamination
□ Label with date opened
□ Discard items past expiration date

FREEZER STORAGE (0°F or below):
□ Wrap items tightly to prevent freezer burn
□ Label with contents and date frozen
□ Use within recommended timeframe
□ Do not refreeze thawed items

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

5. TEMPERATURE MONITORING

DAILY TEMPERATURE LOG:
□ Check refrigerator temperature: _____ °F (should be 35-38°F)
□ Check freezer temperature: _____ °F (should be 0°F or below)
□ Record on daily log sheet
□ If temperatures are out of range, notify manager immediately

COOKING TEMPERATURES (if applicable):
□ Use food thermometer to verify internal temperatures
□ Record temperatures on cooking log

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

QUALITY CHECKPOINTS:
□ All staff have washed hands properly
□ Work surfaces are clean and sanitized
□ Equipment is clean and in good condition
□ Ingredients are properly stored and labeled
□ Temperature logs are up to date
□ No signs of pests or contamination
□ Trash is emptied regularly

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SAFETY NOTES:
⚠️ NEVER taste food with the same utensil used for mixing
⚠️ NEVER work with food if you are ill
⚠️ ALWAYS wash hands after handling raw eggs
⚠️ ALWAYS keep hot foods hot (135°F+) and cold foods cold (41°F or below)
⚠️ When in doubt, THROW IT OUT

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

EMERGENCY CONTACTS:
Health Department: _______________
Manager: _______________
Equipment Repair: _______________

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

APPROVAL:
Created by: _________________ Date: _______
Approved by: ________________ Date: _______
Next Review: _______

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

templates.title: Packaging & Customer Service SOP Template
templates.content:
STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE
PACKAGING CUSTOMER ORDERS

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TITLE: Packaging Pastries, Cookies, and Cakes
LAST UPDATED: [Date]
REVIEW DATE: [Date + 6 months]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

OBJECTIVE:
To ensure all bakery items are packaged correctly, maintaining product quality and presentation for optimal customer satisfaction.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SCOPE:
This SOP applies to all staff involved in packaging and customer service.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

MATERIALS NEEDED:
□ Bakery tissue paper
□ Boxes (various sizes)
□ Bakery tongs or food-safe gloves
□ Bakery string or tape
□ Shopping bags
□ Product labels (if required)
□ Stickers/business cards (optional)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

PROCEDURE:

STEP 1: RECEIVE THE ORDER
□ Greet customer warmly
□ Confirm customer selections
□ Repeat order back to ensure accuracy
□ Ask about any special requests or dietary restrictions

STEP 2: PREPARE WORK SURFACE
□ Place clean bakery tissue on counter or display case top
□ Ensure work area is clean and free of debris
□ Have packaging materials within reach

STEP 3: GATHER ITEMS
□ Use bakery tongs or tissue paper to collect items
□ NEVER touch food with bare hands
□ Handle items gently to avoid damage
□ Verify each item matches customer order

STEP 4: CATEGORIZE ITEMS
□ Group refrigerated items separately from non-refrigerated items
□ Separate delicate items from sturdy items
□ Keep allergen-containing items separate (if applicable)

STEP 5: SELECT APPROPRIATE BOX
□ Choose size that fits items without overcrowding
   - Too small = crushed products
   - Too large = products slide around
□ Items should have about 1 inch of space around them
□ For multiple items, use dividers if available

STEP 6: ASSEMBLE & LINE BOX
□ Build box properly - ensure all flaps are secure
□ Line bottom and sides with fresh bakery tissue
□ Tissue should be clean and wrinkle-free

STEP 7: LOAD BOX
□ Arrange items neatly
□ Place heavier/sturdier items on bottom
□ Place delicate items on top
□ Add crumpled tissue as padding if needed
□ Ensure items won't shift during transport

STEP 8: ADD LABELS (if required)
□ Attach ingredient labels (required by cottage food laws)
□ Include: Product name, ingredients, allergen warnings, date made, your business name and contact
□ Add business card or thank you sticker

STEP 9: CLOSE & SECURE
□ If items fit comfortably: Close box fully
□ Tie with bakery string (preferred) or secure with tape
□ If items are too tall: Partially close lid and secure with tape at an angle
□ Ensure box won't open during transport

STEP 10: BAG THE ORDER
□ Place box in shopping bag upright
□ Add receipt or order confirmation (if applicable)
□ Include care instructions if needed (e.g., "Refrigerate upon arrival")

STEP 11: HAND TO CUSTOMER
□ Hand bag to customer with both hands
□ Provide any special instructions (storage, serving, etc.)
□ Thank customer sincerely
□ Confirm they have everything they ordered

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SPECIAL PACKAGING GUIDELINES:

CAKES (TIERED OR DECORATED):
□ Use sturdy cake box with proper height
□ Place non-slip mat or damp paper towel under cake
□ Secure box with tape on all sides
□ Mark box "THIS SIDE UP" and "FRAGILE"
□ Provide carrying instructions to customer

COOKIES:
□ Layer cookies with tissue paper between layers
□ Do not stack more than 3 layers
□ Ensure cookies are completely cool before packaging

CUPCAKES:
□ Use cupcake box with inserts
□ Ensure cupcakes fit snugly in compartments
□ Do not stack cupcakes
□ Keep box level during transport

REFRIGERATED ITEMS:
□ Package last (just before customer pickup)
□ Use insulated bag if customer has long drive
□ Provide storage instructions
□ Note expiration/use-by date

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

QUALITY CHECKPOINTS:
□ No items are crushed or damaged
□ Box is secure and won't open during transport
□ Customer received correct items
□ Presentation looks professional
□ All required labels are attached
□ Customer understands storage/serving instructions

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SAFETY NOTES:
⚠️ ALWAYS use tongs or tissue - never bare hands
⚠️ Keep refrigerated items separate from room temperature items
⚠️ Check for allergen cross-contamination
⚠️ Wash hands before and after packaging
⚠️ Ensure all labels are accurate (especially allergen warnings)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TROUBLESHOOTING:

Problem: Box too small
Solution: Use next size up - do not force items into small box

Problem: Items sliding in box
Solution: Add crumpled tissue as padding, use smaller box, or add dividers

Problem: Out of boxes
Solution: Check storage area, use alternative packaging, notify manager immediately

Problem: Customer wants to add items
Solution: Repackage if necessary to ensure proper fit and presentation

Problem: Damaged item discovered during packaging
Solution: Replace with fresh item, notify manager, do not give damaged products to customers

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

CUSTOMER SERVICE TIPS:
□ Smile and make eye contact
□ Use customer's name if known
□ Handle products with care (shows you value quality)
□ Explain what you're doing (builds trust)
□ Ask if they have questions
□ Thank them for their business
□ Invite them to follow on social media or join email list

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

NOTES FOR UPDATES:
If packaging supplies are running low, notify manager.
If you discover a better packaging method, document and share with team.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

APPROVAL:
Created by: _________________ Date: _______
Approved by: ________________ Date: _______
Next Review: _______

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

templates.title: Opening & Closing Procedures SOP Template
templates.content:
STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE
OPENING & CLOSING PROCEDURES

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TITLE: Daily Opening and Closing Procedures
LAST UPDATED: [Date]
REVIEW DATE: [Date + 6 months]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

OBJECTIVE:
To ensure the bakery kitchen is properly prepared for production and safely secured at end of day.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SCOPE:
This SOP applies to all staff responsible for opening or closing the bakery.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

OPENING PROCEDURES
Estimated Time: 30 minutes

ARRIVAL (First 5 minutes):
□ Arrive [time] minutes before start time
□ Unlock door and turn on lights
□ Disarm security system (if applicable)
□ Check for any signs of break-in or damage
□ Check voicemail and messages

KITCHEN INSPECTION (5 minutes):
□ Walk through entire kitchen
□ Check for any pest activity
□ Verify all equipment is in place
□ Check for any maintenance issues
□ Report any problems to manager immediately

TEMPERATURE CHECKS (5 minutes):
□ Check refrigerator temperature: _____ °F (should be 35-38°F)
□ Check freezer temperature: _____ °F (should be 0°F or below)
□ Record temperatures on daily log
□ If out of range, notify manager and check food safety

EQUIPMENT STARTUP (10 minutes):
□ Turn on oven and preheat to [temperature]°F
□ Verify oven temperature with thermometer
□ Turn on mixer and test function
□ Check that all small equipment is clean and ready
□ Fill sanitizer bucket with fresh solution
□ Test sanitizer concentration with test strip

WORK AREA PREPARATION (5 minutes):
□ Wipe down all work surfaces with sanitizer
□ Set up production stations
□ Gather tools and equipment for day's production
□ Check production schedule for the day
□ Review any special orders or notes

INGREDIENT PREPARATION (5 minutes):
□ Bring refrigerated ingredients to room temperature (if needed)
□ Check ingredient inventory for day's production
□ Note any low-stock items
□ Verify all ingredients are within expiration dates

FINAL CHECKS:
□ Wash hands thoroughly
□ Put on clean apron and hair covering
□ Review production schedule one more time
□ Ready to begin production!

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

CLOSING PROCEDURES
Estimated Time: 45 minutes

PRODUCTION WRAP-UP (10 minutes):
□ Complete all baking for the day
□ Allow products to cool completely
□ Package or store finished products properly
□ Label all items with date and product name
□ Store in appropriate location (refrigerator, freezer, or room temp)

EQUIPMENT CLEANING (15 minutes):
□ Turn off oven and allow to cool
□ Clean mixer and all attachments
□ Wash all bowls, utensils, and tools
□ Sanitize all equipment
□ Wipe down oven exterior
□ Clean stovetop (if used)
□ Empty and clean sanitizer bucket

WORK SURFACE CLEANING (10 minutes):
□ Clear all work surfaces
□ Wash with hot soapy water
□ Rinse thoroughly
□ Sanitize with approved sanitizer
□ Allow to air dry
□ Wipe down walls and backsplash if needed

FLOOR CLEANING (5 minutes):
□ Sweep entire kitchen floor
□ Mop with appropriate cleaner
□ Pay special attention to corners and under equipment
□ Allow floor to dry before leaving

TRASH & RECYCLING (3 minutes):
□ Empty all trash cans
□ Replace with fresh liners
□ Take trash to outside bins
□ Secure lids to prevent pests
□ Wash hands after handling trash

FINAL INSPECTION (5 minutes):
□ Walk through entire kitchen
□ Verify all equipment is turned off
□ Check that all food is properly stored
□ Ensure refrigerator and freezer doors are closed
□ Turn off lights in work areas
□ Check that all faucets are turned off
□ Lock all windows

CLOSING TASKS (5 minutes):
□ Complete end-of-day checklist
□ Note any equipment issues or supply needs
□ Set up for next day if possible
□ Review tomorrow's production schedule
□ Leave notes for next shift if needed

SECURITY (2 minutes):
□ Turn off all lights
□ Arm security system (if applicable)
□ Lock all doors
□ Verify doors are secure
□ Leave premises

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

DAILY CHECKLIST

OPENING:
□ Temperature log completed
□ Equipment tested and functional
□ Work surfaces sanitized
□ Production schedule reviewed
□ Ready for production

CLOSING:
□ All equipment cleaned and turned off
□ All food properly stored
□ Kitchen cleaned and sanitized
□ Trash emptied
□ Doors locked and secured

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

EMERGENCY PROCEDURES:

IF EQUIPMENT IS NOT WORKING:
1. Do not attempt to fix yourself
2. Notify manager immediately
3. Document issue on maintenance log
4. Adjust production schedule if needed

IF TEMPERATURE IS OUT OF RANGE:
1. Check thermometer accuracy
2. Notify manager immediately
3. Check food safety - discard if necessary
4. Do not use equipment until repaired

IF YOU DISCOVER A PEST PROBLEM:
1. Do not disturb the area
2. Notify manager immediately
3. Document location and type of pest
4. Do not use affected area until resolved

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

SAFETY NOTES:
⚠️ Never leave oven unattended when in use
⚠️ Always verify equipment is off before leaving
⚠️ Report any safety hazards immediately
⚠️ Keep emergency contact numbers accessible
⚠️ Know location of fire extinguisher and first aid kit

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

EMERGENCY CONTACTS:
Manager: _______________
Owner: _______________
Equipment Repair: _______________
Fire Department: 911
Poison Control: 1-800-222-1222

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

APPROVAL:
Created by: _________________ Date: _______
Approved by: ________________ Date: _______
Next Review: _______

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
